SoilHydro 0.1.0
  • Vignette
  • Reference

Pore-size classes (macro/meso/micro) from VG parameters

vg_pore_classes.Rd

Partitions porosity into three classes using capillary theory:

  • Macro: pores with diameter greater than d_macro_um (default 1000 um)

  • Meso: pores with diameter between d_micro_um and d_macro_um (default 10–1000 um)

  • Micro: pores with diameter less than d_micro_um (default 10 um)

By default, residual water \(\\theta_r\) is included in the micro class so that macro + meso + micro \(\\approx \\theta_s\) and percentage bars (basis = "theta_s") sum to 100\

vg_pore_classes(
  params_df,
  id_col = NULL,
  d_micro_um = 10,
  d_macro_um = 1000,
  gamma = 0.0728,
  cos_theta_c = 1,
  percent_basis = c("theta_s", "available"),
  include_residual_in_micro = TRUE,
  return_residual = FALSE,
  filter_id = NULL
)

Arguments

params_df

Output of vg_fit_optim().

id_col

Name of the ID column in params_df. Defaults to the first column.

d_micro_um, d_macro_um

Diameter cutoffs in micrometers (um).

gamma

Surface tension of water (N/m), default ~0.0728 at 20 degrees C.

cos_theta_c

Contact angle term (dimensionless), default 1.

percent_basis

Either "theta_s" (total porosity) or "available" (i.e., \(\\theta_s - \\theta_r\)).

include_residual_in_micro

If TRUE (default), the micro class includes \(\\theta_r\).

return_residual

If TRUE, also returns theta_residual and pct_residual.

filter_id

Optional scalar to compute results for a single ID (rows where params_df[[id_col]] == filter_id).

Value

A data.frame with columns: <ID>, theta_macro, theta_meso, theta_micro, pct_macro, pct_meso, pct_micro, theta_r, theta_s (and residual columns if requested).

Examples

# Using 'fits' from vg_fit_optim():
# Percent basis = theta_s (default). Residual water included in "micro".
psd <- vg_pore_classes(fits, id_col = "ID", percent_basis = "theta_s",
                       include_residual_in_micro = TRUE)
#> Error: object 'fits' not found
psd
#> Error: object 'psd' not found

# Use "available" basis = (theta_s - theta_r) and exclude residual from micro:
psd_avail <- vg_pore_classes(fits, id_col = "ID",
                             percent_basis = "available",
                             include_residual_in_micro = FALSE,
                             return_residual = TRUE)
#> Error: object 'fits' not found
psd_avail
#> Error: object 'psd_avail' not found

# Adjust pore-diameter cutoffs (micro < 5 µm, macro > 500 µm):
psd_custom <- vg_pore_classes(fits, id_col = "ID", d_micro_um = 5, d_macro_um = 500)
#> Error: object 'fits' not found
head(psd_custom)
#> Error: object 'psd_custom' not found
